newsitem.title: USA: GOLF-POOLEY, JURGENSEN SHARE LEAD AT DEPOSIT GUARANTY CLASSIC.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-POOLEY, JURGENSEN SHARE LEAD AT DEPOSIT GUARANTY CLASSIC.

text.p: Don Pooley, a 22-year PGA Tour veteran, and Steve Jurgensen, who flunked out as a tour rookie last year, were tied for the lead Friday after 36 holes of the $1 million Deposit Guaranty Classic.
Pooley, 45, who has won more than $3 million on tour, shot a second-round 68 for a 36-hole total of 11-under-par 133. Jurgensen, 35, followed his first-round 66 with a 67.
Jurgensen lost his PGA Tour exemption last year when he finished 152nd on the money list. He is playing the Deposit Guaranty on a sponsor's exemption after finishing 10th in the tournament last year.
"It would be great to win again, more for my kids," said Poole, whose last tour victory was at The Memorial in 1987. "They were young last time I won, so it would be neat for them."
One shot back were David Ogrin (67-67) and Steve Lowery, whose second-round 65 was the day's low score at the Jack Nicklaus-designed Annandale Golf Club.
Scott Verplank, who won the 1985 Western Open as an amateur, was another stroke away at 135 (67-68), where he was joined by Woody Austin (66-69) and Billy Ray Brown (69-66).
Verplank, a former U.S. Amateur champion, is trying to play his way back into form after elbow problems, which led to three surgeries and threatened to end his career.

"I'm getting there," Verplank, 33, said. "I'm playing better. I've shot six straight rounds in the 60s on tour, so obviously I'm playing pretty well. I'm not completely over the hump, but it's getting better."
Three shots out of the lead at 136 were Bobby Wadkins, Mike Standly, Brian Claar, Brian Henninger, John Adams, Jack O'Keefe, Skip Kendall and Joey Sindelar.
First-round co-leaders Mike Brisky and Craig Kanada, who shot 64s Thursday, did not fare well Friday. Kanada shot 73 and Brisky soared to a 74.
